short_summary: The Ocean Ecology and Biogeochemistry Department at Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) needs geomatic resources to help with the development and enhancement of the: Salish Sea Initiative Interactive Map (SSIM), Salish Sea Initiative Data Portal (SSIDP); and Salish Sea Initiative Marine Survey App Tool (SSIMT); using a unique, required co-development approach that is the foundation for the Salish Sea Initiative project(s) implementation.

full_summary:
**Title:** Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)
**Reference Number:** 30003724A Solicitation Number: 30003724A
**Organization:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO)

**Date and Time:**
Solicitation Date: September 7, 2023
Closing Date: September 22, 2023, 4:00 pm Eastern Daylight Saving Time (EDT)

The Ocean Ecology and Biogeochemistry Section at Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites qualified suppliers to submit a proposal for Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) under the contract number EN578-170432.

**Project Background:**
This project is part of the Salish Sea Initiative, a collaborative effort aimed at providing interactive decision-making tools to support sustainable ocean management and conservation. Our team proposes to enhance and expand the existing interactive map and data portal, as well as develop a mobile field survey app tool to support data collection and analysis.

**Scope of Work:**
We require the services of four geomatics experts under the following categories:

1. Geomatics Analyst, Junior Level: 60 days
2. Geomatics Analyst, Senior Level: 68 days
3. Geographic Information System (GIS) Programmer/Analyst, Intermediate Level: 70 days
4. GIS Project Manager, Senior Level: 30 days

**Project Timeline:**
We anticipate the project to commence on November 1, 2023. The contract duration is for one year, with two irrevocable one-year options to extend the term.

**Proposal Requirements:**
Interested suppliers must meet the required qualification standards under the Tier 1 category as listed in the GB580-130794 services procurement document available on the BuyAndSell.GC.CA website. A mandatory proposal conference will be held to discuss the project requirements and technical specifications.

**Security Requirements:**
This project is classified as low-risk, and no security clearance is required.

**Contact Information:**
For any inquiries, please contact Bassam El-Daya at DFO.tenders-soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or email Bassam.El-Daya@dfo-mpo.gc.ca.

Kindly submit your proposal to the following email address:

* [contract-posting-advisories-gc@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:contract-posting-advisories-gc@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
**Confirmation of RFP Availability:**
Only qualified proposers will receive
